sen.j: 児島 惟謙（こじま これかた、1837年3月7日（天保8年2月1日 (旧暦)） - 1908年（明治41年）7月1日）は、明治期の司法官。
sen.e: Korekata KOJIMA (March 7, 1837-July 1, 1908) was a judicial officer in Meiji Period.

sen.j: 後述する大津事件の際には、大審院長として司法権の政治部門からの独立を守り抜き、「護法の神」などと高く評価された。
sen.e: At Otsu Incident described later, he, as the chief justice of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan), persisted in the independence of judicature from governing section and was highly evaluated as "the God of protecting the Constitution".

sen.e: He experienced the president of Nagoya Court and so forth, and became the chief justice of Osaka kosoin (Osaka court of appeal) in 1883, then in 1886 he supported the establishment of Kansai Horitsu Gakko (Kansai Law School), the predecessor of Kansai University, and became a honorary member of the school.

sen.j: 1891年に大審院長に就任し、間もなく大津事件が発生した。
sen.e: Soon after he assumed office as the chief justice of Daishin-in in 1891, the Otsu Incident occurred.

sen.j: 被告人である津田三蔵は大逆罪により大津地方裁判所に起訴された。
sen.e: Sanzo TSUDA, the accused, was prosecuted for high treason to Otsu District Court.

sen.j: 総理大臣松方正義ら政府首脳が大逆罪の適用を強く主張していたこともあり、大審院は事件を自ら処理することとした。
sen.e: The Prime Minister, Masayoshi MATSUKATA, and other senior Japanese governmental officials strongly insisted on the application of high treason, so the Daishin-in decided to deal with the incident by themselves.

sen.j: これに対して、児島は津田の行為は大逆罪の構成要件に該当しない（罪刑法定主義を参照）との信念のもと、担当司法官一人ひとりの説得に当たった。
sen.e: For this, Kojima, under a belief that Tsuda's act did not meet the necessary condition for high treason (cf. the principle of "nulla poena sine lege"; the principle of legality), tried to talk into compliance the judicial officers in charge one by one.

On the other hand, KOJIMA, under a belief that TSUDA's act did not constitute high treason (cf. the principle of "nulla poena sine lege"; the principle of legality), tried to persuade the judicial officers in charge to support him one by one.

sen.j: 結局、大審院は津田の行為に謀殺未遂罪を適用して無期徒刑を宣告した。
sen.e: In the end Daishin-in applied attempted murder to Tsuda's act and sentenced him penal servitude for an indefinite term.

sen.j: 児島は、司法権の独立の維持に貢献した「護法の神」と日本の世論から高く評価された。
sen.e: Kojima, by his contribution toward maintaining the independence of the judicature, earned an excellent reputation from Japan's public opinion as "the God of protecting the Constitution".

sen.j: 児島は、当時の欧米列強からも日本の近代化の進展ぶりを示すものという評価を受けた。
sen.e: The allied western powers at that time evaluated his act as an indicator of Japan's developed modernization.

sen.j: しかし、司法権の独立とは、単に政治部門（立法、行政）は裁判所の判断に干渉できないという司法権の外部からの独立のみを指すのではない。
sen.e: However, independence of the judicature does not simply mean the independence of judicature from the outside, that is, it does not mean that the court decision should not be interfered by the governing section (legislation and administration).

sen.e: It includes independent judgment of judges as well, that is, individual judges are capable of forming a judgment independently without being interfered by their fellow workers and his superior.

sen.e: From this point of view, while Kojima kept the independence of judicature from the outside, he violated the independent judgment of the judges.
